nodes.bodyText: I prefer to use upper case for static final constants...

The logger reference is not a constant, but a final reference, and should NOT be in uppercase. A constant VALUE should be in uppercase. 😉
See https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1417190/should-a-static-final-logger-be-declared-in-upper-case
I had the same discussion with the launcher team back then: fabric8-launcher/launcher-application#263

Fair enough. For me anything static final feels like a constant and I prefer to use upper case because it's very clear in the code (I'm not going to dive into the immutability discussions ;-). However, I don't think it's a good idea to change this at random. It should be either forced by the formatter or just leave this to the author...

I agree it should be forced by the formatter at some point.
PS: Doing a quick grep I found that logger is more common in the codebase than LOGGER :)

You could consider it a constant so long as the reference is immutable. Which I am not sure about with Logger. Either way, if we are already using upper-case in various places throughout the code, I'd just keep it that way ;-)
